reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in Oct 2011. The hotel is located in the middle of the city and within easy walking distance of the train station. The room was very small and being there was 2 of us, had to step aside to let each other pass. The breakfast was ok, but still felt hungry afterwards. Bar staff and receptionist was all very pleasant. There was too many beggers, who appeared outside every other shop, which wasnt good. Nice city but so very expensive. Trams running past hotel shock the room so if i went back would ask for a back room.
reviews.title: very small room very expensive

reviews.text: Stayed here in May 2011 for business. Extremely expensive and very small rooms. Since i was travelling alone- not a great issue. Location is good. 10 minutes walk from Oslo station and all shops very close by. Stayed here due to the proximity to the congress centre.
reviews.title: Small rooms, very expensive, ideal location

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok. Staff great- all spoke good english- much better than my non existent norwegian!
reviews.title: Great staff, great location

reviews.text: Overall if you get a good deal, stay here but even for couples on a short trip, it is going to be a bit of a squeeze in the room.
reviews.title: Centrally, clean & reasonable priced

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights and would have given it a slightly lower rating if the staff hadn't been so nice about everything.The internet connection didn't work for about 24 hours but we were offered the option of using the internet connection at the sister hotel just around the corner. The staff at the breakfast buffet were so nice that one morning when I had to rush off to an early meeting they putting together a little box of pastry and fruit so that I wouldn't be hungry. The restaurant and bar manager was also really friendly and helpful, recommending several good restaurants to us. He along with his staff were also very knowledgeable about the different types of local beers available, recommending some delicious beer from the local micro brewery.
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed

reviews.text: Location was great. The bus from the airport stops just across the hotel and you can reach nearly all attraction places just after a short walk from the hotel. We stayed in a small but comfortable room. Breakfast was unexpectedly excellent for a three star hotel..
reviews.title: excellent three star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room design is "cold" and unpleasant. No cupboards or even drawers, so we couldn't unpack.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: There was also an unpleasant smell from one corner of the room. We couldn't identify the source. Perhaps it was from the armchair's upholstery.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Other than that - the hotel is fine. Convenient location, efficient staff, good breakfast.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel. Easy walk to train station and in the center of town. Highly recommended. Rooms are big and comfortable. Breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: Good wheelchair access, great location and fantastic breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the G20 when in oslo for 3 nights and everything was excellent from the service at the reception to the bed to the breakfast which was the best I've got anywhere it is the breakfast for the Norwegian winter olympic athletes. the room was really well designed with very comfortable beds and big flat screen tv, my flight tickets which were printed fell down by the locker and as the furniture was built in could not be moved but the receptionist tried printing them for me there and when her printer broke she rang there sister hotel across the road where i went to get them, very helpful and left a lasting effect on me
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was one of the most expensive on a 6 week trip and the most disappointing. It’s new but the rooms are very small and cramped. There’s about a 30cm gap between the end of the bed and the wall, two people can’t pass each other. Hanging space consists of 3 ‘arty’ coat hangers attached to the wall, no cupboard for putting shoes, suitcases and travel gear out of the way to create a bit more space. With two adults this room was too cramped and not worth the cost. There’s no facility to make hot drinks which means you have to buy them at Oslo prices which are expensive and add to daily costs. Three positives – the location is excellent with good access to transport and tourist attractions, the room was clean and the breakfast was excellent. We wouldn’t stay with this chain again as felt we were being treated like cattle but paying like kings. Poor value and off-hand staff. 5/10
reviews.title: Not happy - small and expensive

reviews.text: I booked the Rica G20 sight unseen based on the Trip Advisor reviews. They were spot on. Book ahead during the week as it is crowded, but it has one of the best locations in town to walk to everything. 5 minute walk to Nationaltheatret train station. Modern and efficient.
reviews.title: Great Location, great breakfast, nice helpful staff, clean, modern but small rooms

reviews.text: Friendly staff, good breakfast but very noisy from trafic and slaming doors in all other rooms (shaking walls, lamps and you can even feel the shaking in the bed). The room was extremely small with no closet or anything to hang clothes on.
reviews.title: Nice but noisy

reviews.text: Stayed at the Rica G20 for 3 nights in Oct 2011. The location is ideal, 10 minutes walk from the bus/train station, just a few metres from Karl Johans gate, and within easy walking distance of the Opera House, City Hall, Aker Brygge and Akershus Fortress.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very good breakfast, ideal for short stay in Oslo

reviews.text: As others have noted this hotel is very well located, it has free and good quality high speed internet and the breakfast is great. It was sufficient for my purposes and the right price. This is not a "fancy" hotel by any means but on the other hand I do not believe that most hotels in oslo match up with top tier hotels elsewhere due to the extreme cost of labor here.
reviews.title: No in room safe, poor room ventilation, no closet

reviews.text: There are two things that would probably prevent me from staying here another time: There is no in room safe to lock your laptop or camera. Also, the rooms have poor ventilation. The windows do not open and the ventilation system seems to be very passive. I could not hear any fan when I pushed the button for "extra ventilation" (this button turns itself off while you sleep). Fortunately, I visited during a time of very mild weather and the heat was not on. I could very easily see how the rooms could get too hot or stuffy.
reviews.title: Hot in a relatively cold city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, while not a deal breaker, I am not sure why they thought it was a good idea to require you to hang your clothes on hooks in the wall instead of installing a closet or wardrobe.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: The hotel website offered the best deal of all of them so if you decide to book you should compare the rate offered by the Rica hotel site first.
reviews.title: Small rooms but high standard and great service

reviews.text: When the bathroom is bigger than your bedroom, you're content you're not staying for more than a night. Still, the bed was large and comfortable. If you, like me, don't plan on staying in for the night, the sleeping place is really almost all that matters. That and cleanliness, quietness and room temperature. Quite happy with the two first, close to desperation regarding the last: I woke up in a sweat in the middle of the night. The balcony door which served as a window, was not possible to open. Understandably so, as there was no balcony outside...
reviews.title: Small, expensive, but high quality
